title: CVE-2019-5736: Escape from Docker and Kubernetes containers to root on host
content:
description here:
https://blog.dragonsector.pl/2019/02/cve-2019-5736-escape-from-docker-and.html
PoC: https://github.com/q3k/cve-2019-5736-poc
Some more links:
https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2019/q1/119
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2019-5736
Impact
It allows to escape from container to root on host when unpatched version of Docker and Kubernetes are used.
This affects a pretty big part of internet, since a lot of services are using Docker and Kubernets these days.
It has also serious impact on cloud services
AWS https://aws.amazon.com/security/security-bulletins/AWS-2019-002/ and GCP https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/security-bulletins#february-11-2019-runc
https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/02/11/runc-and-cve-2019-5736/
steps: Create a malicious container image that overwrites the host's runC binary when executed.
Run the malicious container image on an unpatched Docker or Kubernetes host.
vuln_description: CVE-2019-5736 is a container escape vulnerability that allows an attacker to gain root access on the host system by exploiting a flaw in the runC container runtime. The vulnerability occurs when a malicious container can overwrite the host's runC binary, which is then executed with root privileges when the container is started or attached to.
reason: This vulnerability involves understanding the interaction between container runtimes (runC), Docker, and Kubernetes, as well as the subtle way in which the runC binary can be hijacked. The attacker needs to manipulate the container's execution flow to overwrite the host's runC binary, which requires deep knowledge of container internals and the runtime environment.
